Rules

Assignment Rules

Set Up Assignment Rules

Auto-Response Rules

Escalation Actions
 
An escalation rule can reassign the case to another support agent or queue. An escalation rule also sends notification emails to the new assignee, current case owner, and other recipients.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience
Available in: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

Let’s break down the parts of an escalation action:

Age Over
Salesforce escalates the case if it hasn’t been closed within a specified time period. For example, escalate the case if it hasn’t been closed within five hours.

Auto-Reassign Cases
When a case escalates, Salesforce can reassign the case to a different user or queue.

Notify Users
When a case escalates, Salesforce can send a notification email so that a user, the current case owner, or other email recipients know that the case is escalating.

Escalation Rule Examples and Best Practices
